Package com.mongodb.client.model.search

Interface SearchScore

All Superinterfaces:
org.bson.conversions.Bson
All Known Subinterfaces:
ConstantSearchScore, FunctionSearchScore, PathBoostSearchScore, ValueBoostSearchScore
@Sealed @Beta(CLIENT) public interface SearchScore extends org.bson.conversions.Bson
A modifier of the relevance score. You may use the $meta: "searchScore" expression, e.g., via Projections.metaSearchScore(String), to extract the relevance score assigned to each found document.
Since:
4.7
MongoDB Atlas documentation
Scoring

    • of

      static SearchScore of(org.bson.conversions.Bson score)
      Creates a SearchScore from a Bson in situations when there is no builder method that better satisfies your needs. This method cannot be used to validate the syntax.

      Example
      The following code creates two functionally equivalent SearchScores, though they may not be equal. 

      
  SearchScore score1 = SearchScore.boost(
      SearchPath.fieldPath("fieldName"));
  SearchScore score2 = SearchScore.of(new Document("boost",
      new Document("path", SearchPath.fieldPath("fieldName").toValue())));
      Parameters:
      score - A Bson representing the required SearchScore.
      Returns:
      The requested SearchScore.
